text: A CRYO-LOCKER BLOWS OPEN, spitting out... CAROLYN FRY. She hits the deck of the main cabin: Four cr lockers in a forward section, countless more in back. But deck is canted at a sick angle and ALARMS SCREAM everywhe The world is dying around her. Legs wobbly, shivering like a flu victim, Fry stumbles to next forward locker. It's riddled with holes. One DEAD CR is seen through fractured plexi, body pocked and bloodied in the next cryo-locked... The CAPTAIN is struggling awake. Fry's face floods with r Slapping an intercom:
Hear me? Cap'n? Some kinda compromise to the hull...holding for now, but...Goddamn, I'm glad you're alive. Gotta pull your E-release...no, red handle, red handle. I'll get the warm-ups out while --
Particles bore through the cabin

blasting open the captain's chest, shattering plexi, DETO INSTRUMENTS on the opposite wall and leaving CONTRAILS HISSING in the air. Fry lands on her ass, horrified. Suddenly... Another LOCKER BLOWS OPEN. A body falls right on top of F but this one's still alive. Disoriented, frantic:
Why did I fall on you?
He's dead. Cap'n's dead. Christ, I was looking right at him when --
I mean, I mean, chrono shows we're 22 weeks out, so gravity wasn't supposed to kick in for another 19. I mean, I mean, I mean, why did I fall  at all
You hear me? Captain's dead. Owens too.
Oh, no. Not Owens, not.... Wai', wai', wait.  I'm Owens . Right? They swap nightmare looks, momentarily unsure of their ow identities.
Cryo-sleep. Swear to God, it sloughs brain cells.
They stumble into nav-bay. ALARMS CONTINUE. Fry grabs war suits out of storage, pitches one to Owens, checks her sc
1550 millibars, dropping 20 MB per minute, shit, we're hemorrhaging air.  Somethin' took a swipe at us.

Just tell me we're still in the shipping lane. Just show me all those stars, all those bright, beautiful, deep-space.... Owens activates an exterior view:  A planet rushes up at us . That's why they have gravity.
Jesus God....
The SHIP PLOWS through the upper atmosphere, antennae pyl already disintegrating.
Heart battering her ribs, Fry runs forward, using hand-ho steady herself. Over a headset:
They trained you for this, right? Fry?
She doesn't answer.

Fry harnesses in, starts running switches -- but fumbles times, making mental errors. Finally she gets crash-shutt open to reveal... CLOUD STRATA sweeping up past the windscreen like floor-l on a dropping elevator. We're shedding  big altitude.
... crisis program selected Number Two of this system because it shows at least  some oxygen and more than 1,500 -- would you
(hammers a button, SILENCES ALARMS)
-- more than 1,500-millibars of pressure at surface-level. Okay, so maybe the ship did something right for a change....
As Fry runs more switches.
As JETTISON DOORS CLOSE around the ship.
As Fry flips up a security-latch -- and thumbs the switch

MULTIPLE SHOTS: EXPLOSIVE BOLTS RAPID-FIRE around the shi skin, blowing away non-essentials that hinder aerodynamic including big deep-space drives. But this last separation the ship into a dangerous roll.
Out the windscreen, cloud strata roll vertiginously. Fry actuators...
And airbrakes deploy. She manages to kill the roll. But t ship's still coming in nose-high.

...showing no major water bodies...maximum terrain, 220 meters over mean surface... largely cinder and gypsum with some evaporite deposits.... JETTISON DOORS CLOSE behind Owens, segregating him from t passenger compartment. It scares him for a  new reason.
Fry? What're you doing?
Fry flips up a new security-latch. INTERCUTTING:
Fry?
Can't get my nose down...too much load back there....
You mean that "load" of passengers?
So what, we should both go down too? Out of sheer fucking nobility? Tortured silence. Fry's thumb moves to the switch that wi jettison the passenger cabin. Jettison 50 people.

SELECTED SHOTS of faces inside cryo-lockers, among them J He's prime-of-life, badge on display, some kind of cop. S awake, he clears condensation to check the locker directl from his, finding... RIDDICK. Small black goggles hide his eyes. A metal bit w in his mouth lends a perpetual grimace. A read-out admoni

text: Look, Fry. Company says we're responsible for every one of those --
Company's not here, is it?
When captain went down, you stepped up -- whether you like it or not. Now they train you for this, so --
And there wasn't a simulated cockroach alive within 50 clicks of the simulated crash site!  That's how they train you! On a fucking simulator! Owens unbuckles from his chair.
Don't touch that switch! Overcome by guilt, Fry retracts her thumb of mass destruc But a HUGE JOLT puts the thumb right back.
I'm not dying for them. She pushes it . But this time...
No bolts fire. Nothing separates from the SHIP THAT SCREA through the clouds.
Now we see why: Owens reopened the jettison doors locally blocked them open.
Owens!
70 seconds! You still got 70 seconds to level this beast out!

Seething anger and guilt, Fry pops more airbrakes, sheddi speed, more heat. The ship  does level -- but it's still being pounded hellishly. She tries to get a stable view out... The windscreen. We're breaking through cloud-bottoms. The just a glimpse of landscape before...
An airbrake fails . It shears off and pinwheels into...
The windscreen.  It cracks into a thousand spiderwebs -- but impossibly it holds. For now.

What the shit was that? Sunlight flares from every fractured edge: It's like look into burning diamonds, and Fry can only get an impression of the outside world. Now she has to rely on... A ground-mapping display. 120 meters altitude. And droppi
INTERCUT Johns. Realizing he's in some kind of shit-storm claws at safety restraints.

Ground-mapper: 60 meters. COLLISION ALARMS kick in. Out the fractured windscreen, we see a huge dark mass ris into view.  Land . 40 meters...30...20...10.... Fry braces. IMPACT. The WINDSCREENS IMPLODE. AIR HURRICANES in.
IMPACT. Chairs rip from their moorings. Strapped into one Owens slams into the ceiling.

IMPACT. Johns BLOWS OUT of his locker -- and wishes to Go would've stayed inside, because just beside him... The hull is cracking open . NIGHTMARE SHOT: A huge section of the cabin tears free... skitters and CRASHES along the planetfloor behind us...an disintegrates out of sight. 40 cryo-lockers vanished with 40 lives.

Hammered by WIND, Fry opens her eyes experimentally. FRY'S POV: A vortex of motion, of speed, of blurring debr But the ship is burrowing in. Burrowing  under . Fry pivots her chair 180 degrees a nanosecond before... Dirt avalanches into the cockpit . It buries CAMERA.

Choking yellow dust. Ghostly silhouettes are COUGHING, MO CALLING OUT to other survivors in English and, surreally, Arabic. Soon we find... Johns. Ears running blood. Stumbling his way to... Riddick's cryo-locker. Empty. Johns reaches for his holst Gone, torn right off his belt. No prisoner and no weapon spooky combination. Nearby he sees... The light of a cutting torch. Someone's using it to open jammed cryo-locker. The plexi is torched away to reveal.. AUDREY, 12 years old. Unscathed.

Somethin' went wrong, huh? Johns searches for his pistol.  Behind him, two chained feet lower into FRAME -- and then attack, swinging over Johns' head... getting the chain on his neck...twisting hard, using the a choke-collar. Johns flicks open a baton, swings it up a Riddick. Still in body chains and mouth-bit. Clinging to ceiling support. Riding out the baton blows. Seconds from blacking out, Johns strains forward...forwar finally breaks Riddick's grip on the support. He keeps ho the chained feet so that... Riddick SLAMS HEADFIRST into the deck. Johns lays the bat his neck.
One chance and you blew it, Riddick. Never cease to disappoint me.
Darkness. A light beam sweeps the dusty air of the cockpi It's packed with dirt, no signs of life. About to search elsewhere, Johns turns back at...
Hey.
Hey, who?
Hey, me. Over here. His light finds a headrest sticking up from the dirt. Joh crawls closer, checks the other side of the headrest and her. Fry. Buried to the gills.
Amazing. I'm Johns.
Carolyn Fry. I'd shake hands, but... He manages a smile and starts digging her out. Almost dre to ask:
Are there any others, Johns?

Johns helps Fry through the carnage. She's stunned by it but especially by the blast of sunlight where a hull used Realizing she's in nav-bay, Fry starts digging like a sea to uncover... Owens. Still strapped to his chair. Metal rod piercing hi chest close to the heart. Dead. Fry reaches out to touch
Out, out, out, GET IT OUTTA ME! She recoils hard.  He's still alive . The other survivors bungle over. Ten seconds of pure chaos:
Pull it out of him...No, it's too close to the heart...You gotta do it, just do it fast.... Fry grabs the rod.
Don't touch it! Don't touch that switch!
You'll kill him, I'm tellin' you, shit, just leave it alone...delirious...doncha you got some drugs for this poor man....
Don't touch that switch!

Awright, awright, someone...there's Anestaphine in the med-lock, that end of the cabin...next to.... But there is no more "that end." In exquisite pain, Owens screams on. REACTION SHOTS of Johns, Audrey. Seldom are h beings witness to such raw suffering.

Get away. Everybody. The others leave -- except for Audrey, staying behind to in morbid fascination. Johns doubles back and collars her Leaving, they pass... Riddick, cuffed to a bulkhead. His eyes, still hidden by goggles, track Johns and Audrey toward daylight.

The survivors straggle outside. CAMERA SURVEYS new faces: ZEKE and SHAZZA. Male-female team of bushwhackers, partne life. Shazza has a tough sexiness. Zeke's face shows abor blood. (30s.) PARIS. Overfed, overgroomed. A puff pastry of a man. (40s 50s.) Four male "Chrislams": The pillar-steady IMAM (50ish), an THREE PILGRIMS, young and excitable (late-teens). (NOTE: Chrislams represent a union between Christianity and Isla have the iconography of Christians yet the physical look Muslims.) WIDE SHOT: All around them is stark and unforgiving terra The valley floor is relieved only by low hills to one sid spiked with earthen spires. Scorching down on everything two suns -- one red, one yellow.
Well. Our own little slice of heaven. The Chrislams fall to their knees. Confusion as they try orient themselves.

Please...which way to New Mecca? We must know the direction in order to pray. North? South? East? West? Nobody knows. Johns snaps open compass, finds the needle swaying rudderlessly. The SCREA inside the ship finally ends.
As Fry holds Owens, now dead.
The four Chrislams have devised a way to pray: Backs toge each faces a different compass point.
Fry climbs onto the back of the ship. Johns Paris, Zeke, Audrey are already here.
Big talk about a scouting party... Fry sees the huge smoldering scar in the ground behind th One glance confirms that there are no other survivors.
...then we saw this.
Anyone else having breathing problems? Aside from me?
Like I just ran, or something....
Feel one lung short. All of us.
Well, I tend toward the asthmatic. And with all this dust.... Faces turn to Fry: They're looking to her for answers.
It's the atmosphere. Too much pressure, not enough oxygen. Might take a few days to --
So what the bloody hell happened, anyways?
Somethin' knocked us off-lane. Maybe a rogue comet. Maybe we'll never know.
Well, I for one, am thoroughly fucking grateful. This beast wasn't made to land like this. But cripes, you rode it down. (to others)
C'mon, you lousy ingrates, only reason we're alive is a'cuzza her. Others CHIME AGREEMENT, laying thankful hands on Fry's sh HOLD on Fry, her face betraying nothing as they anoint he savior.
Breaking out pressure suits:
Liquid oxygen canisters inside. Start ripping them out. Quick hits only -- try to make it last.
Well, is someone coming for us? Or are we all just gonna die of exposure or dehydration or sunstroke or maybe even something worse? (off their looks)
Hey, you don't have to worry about scaring me.
We're worried you'll scare us. (ushering her away)
Name's "Audrey," right, love? And you're goin' to Taurus Three like we were?
Yeah, but...do we even have enough food to get there? Or will we have to resort to cannibalism?
(to Fry)

I'll see 'bout makin' this air go a bit further, cap'n. With your permission, a' course. Fry blinks.  "They actually think I'm the captain." Zeke and the others get to work. Fry finds herself staring at  another problem. Riddick.
And him?
Big Evil?
We just keep him locked up forever?
Be my choice. Already escaped once from the max-slam facility on --
I don't need his life story. Is he really that dangerous?
Only around humans. Riddick has his mouth on the hull, virtually licking the Fry moves closer -- and now sees it sheeting down the hul
Oh, Christ.... They're losing water . Suddenly Fry is running, snatching up an emergency light, climbing wall-rungs...
And crawling through dusty superstructure to reach the wa cistern. She opens a crank-hatch -- and finds light invad interior. Her face dies.
(shouting)
Well? Is it just the pump?
Ask if anyone has anything in cargo! Anything to drink!
Oversize DOORS RUMBLE open. Fry, Johns, and Paris climb i this dark corridor lined with cargo containers. Each cont has an access door.
Mine here.... As Paris unlocks, Johns steadies himself, suddenly light-
S'matter?
Little swamp-flu from the Conga system. Never shook it with all this cryo-sleep. Paris opens his container to reveal...
Tiffany chairs stacked 10 high. Bronze eagle lecterns. Or umbrellas. Neo-Egyptian castings.
King Tut's tomb....

Be surprised what these will fetch in the Taurus system. Here. This Wooten here -- easy, easy. Very rare. They open the Wooten desk. Cubbyholed inside are dusty bo of sherry. Vintage Port. Glenfiddich. Bicardi 151.
This is it? Booze?  That's what you have to drink?
(educating her)
200-year-old single-malt scotch is to "booze" as foie gras is to "duck guts."
(cracking a bottle)
A toast to whatever he just said.
I'll need a receipt for that. (to Fry)
For all these.
Top of my list. She joins Johns for a drink. Entering, the Chrislams watc both envy and aversion.
I don't suppose....
One of the Christian habits we  didn't adopt -- perhaps unfortunately. We'll have to wait.
For what? There is no water. You understand that, don't you?
All deserts have water, somewhere. God shall lead us there.

START on the cutting torch, abandoned in wreckage. Starin is... Riddick. With his hands cuffed behind him and around a bu he can't get near it. Or can he? Near the ceiling, the bu is fractured -- a slim spot where maybe chains could pass Riddick stands. With a GRUESOME POPPING, he dislocates bo shoulders...carries his arms overhead...passes the chains the broken spot...and brings his arms down in front of hi body-flex POPS HIS SHOULDERS back into joint. Free, he reaches for the cutting torch.
Pistol in hand, Johns runs into a BIG CLOSEUP, eyes sweep Nothing on the horizon. But something lies on the ground It's Riddick's mouth-bit.
Like we needed another way to die.
FAST CLOSEUPS: Hands pillaging storage lockers, pulling o anything that might qualify as a "weapon." It all gets ha back and dumped into...

Nav-bay. Gathered, the survivors take inventory: Johns ha pistol, shotgun, baton. Zeke and Shazza offer up a pick-a digging tools, hunting boomerang. Imam shows a ceremonial Paris straggles in with antique curios.
What the hell are these?
Maratha crow-bill war-picks from Northern India. Very rare.
An' this?
Blow-dart hunting stick from Papua New Guinea. Very  very rare, since the tribe's extinct.
'Cuz they couldn't hunt shit with these things, be my guess.
Well, what's the need, anyway? If he's gone, he's gone. Why should he bother us?
First, because he can only live out there for so long -- he's gonna come back and take what we got. Second, for the sheer thrill of the kill. A beat. They all grab for weapons.

Johns stands atop the crash ship, scanning with a scope. fixates on... A blue glow on the horizon.  "What the hell is it?" Zeke and Shazza modify breather units, adding straps and and ball-floats. The prototype is tested on Audrey. She s on the mouthpiece -- and finds that it works, supplying o demand rather than in a constant flow. Chrislams convert to traditional bedouin head-gear, ready travel. Fry finishes wrapping Owens' body. She looks to the yello low on the horizon. The red sun seems inclined to follow.
Imam. We should leave soon. Before nightfall but while it's cooler.
What, you're goin' off, too?
Johns is leaving you a gun. Just do me a favor, huh? Get my crewies buried? They were good guys who died bad.
A'course we will.
Imam...Imam.... (NOTE: "Imam" is pronounced "el-ee-MAM.") Fry and the others round the ship to see... A blue star flaring into view . It's rising as the other suns are setting.
My bloody oath....
Three suns?
(to Fry)
So much for your nightfall.
So much for my cocktail hour.
We take this to be a good sign -- a path, a direction from God. Johns swings down from the top of the ship.
A very good sign. (re: blue sun)
That's Riddick's direction. You do  not wanna be caught in the dark with this guy.
Thought you found his restraints over there. Toward sunset.
(nodding)
Which means he went toward sunrise.

Trekking, the Chrislams waft incense pots and CHANT FROM THE KORAN as they head toward the blue star. Johns provid shotgun escort; Fry carries Paris' second war-pick on a s Silhouetted against the alien sky, the scouting party is odd sight. Already sun-battered, Johns crafts an eye-visor out of pl Fry tries to wrap her head like the Chrislams. Imam helps
So quiet. You get used to the sounds of the ship, then....
You know who Muhammad was?
Some prophet guy?
"Some prophet guy." And a city man. But he had to travel to the desert -- where there was quiet -- to hear the words of God.
You were on a pilgrimage? To New Mecca?
(nodding)
Chrislam teaches that once in every lifetime should there be a great hajj -- a great pilgrimage. To know God, better, yes, but to know yourself as well.
Frightening thought.
(finishes wrapping her)
We're all on the same hajj now. Fry notices Johns scope-locked on something.
What?
(hands her scope)
Tell me it's not a mirage. SCOPE POV: Beyond a distant rise, strange branches.
Trees?

Paris has taken over as look-out atop the ship. He deals the heat by erecting a "misting" umbrella: He fills a res with liquor, dials up a regulator. Umbrella spars shoot b of cooling alcohol vapor. Paris luxuriates in it.
Comfy up there? Zeke appears below. He loads a scrap-metal sled with tarp cable, pick-ax.
Amazing how you can do without the essentials of life -- so long as you have the luxuries.

Well, just keep your bloody-fuckin' eyes open. Don't want that ratbag sneakin' up on me bloody-fuckin' arse. He drags the sled toward the spired hills. Keeping one ey Zeke, Paris eases into a chair, lays the war-pick across pours himself a spot of sherry. As he sips,  a blade touches his throat .
He'd probably get you right here, right under the jaw. And you'd never hear him coming. That's how good Riddick is. Paris eases the hunting boomerang away.
Now did you run away from your parents? Or did they run away from you?
The scouting party approaches a rise. The trees loom just

Allahu Akbar...Allahu Akbar.... The young pilgrims break into a excited run, anticipating oasis. But Fry hangs back, taking a harder look at the tr They don't move in the wind. The pilgrims scramble up the rise -- and go motionless. F Johns and Imam catch up to behold... The "trees" are actually the dorsal bones of a titanic sk tinted green by lichen.  Beyond is a sea of bleached animal bones . Impossibly, the bones seem to MOAN IN PAIN. All told, it's like Hell overflowed right here.
Is this whole planet dead? A pilgrim questions Imam IN ARABIC.
He asks what could have killed so many great things...
Moving into the boneyard:

Some...communal graveyard, perhaps... like the elephants of Earth.... Fry touches one of the towering bones. It shows cut-marks almost as if the bone was hacked by a sword.  "Graveyard? Or killing field?"
Long time ago. Whatever happened.

Pilgrim #1 reaches a huge skull laced with baleen-like co Wind hitting the comb makes a LOW HARMONIC MOANING. By moving a hand over the comb, the pilgrim can "play" DIRGE MUSIC. Wanting to show off the trick:
Ah.... He looks for Pilgrim #3 but can't spot him. And when he t back to the skull --  a face is staring through the combing . But it's only...

Pilgrim #3, inside the skull. Johns enters and chases him About to leave, Johns notices... Bone-chippings piled on the ground. It could be nothing, still... Johns double-checks shadows, probing with the muzzle of h shotgun. Satisfied, Johns exits. Now BOOM UP to reveal... Riddick . Hidden in a sinus cavity.
Trailing the others, Fry pauses to change out the O2 on h breather.
Riddick drops to the ground. His arms and hands are now p with shards of boneyard ivory -- fashionable little body Spotting a shadow on the combing, he draws closer. And se Alone.
Johns doubles back to Fry. He takes a hit of scotch, offe some.
Probably makes it worse. Dehydrates you even more.
Probably right. They drink anyway. Moving out of the sun, Fry leans up ag the combing. It brings her within arm's length of...
Riddick. He pulls a bone-shiv, freshly chiseled.
You know, I woulda played road dog for these guys. You could've stayed back. Pro'bly should've -- because, you know, if we  don't find water.... "We may not make it back."
No, no, I wanted to get away.
So I noticed. Never seen a "captain" quite so ready to leave her ship. Just as Riddick eases his blade toward Fry's neck...
She steps away.
Better keep moving....

What'd Owens mean? 'Bout not touching the switch? Fry searches his eyes, wondering if she can trust him -- again she leans back on the combing. We can actually see Riddic now. They could too, if they would just TURN THE FUCK ARO
Hey. You can tell me, Carolyn.
Promise me. Swear to me you won't --
You see anybody else here? Just between you and me.
During the landing...when things were at their worst...Owens was at his best. He's the one who wouldn't let the pilot dump the passenger cabin. Johns blinks, stunned.  "Are you shittin' me?"
Trying again, Riddick reaches out with his shiv -- and de slices off some of Fry's hair. A locket. A souvenir. That all he wanted.
So now you know.
Fuck. Guess I'm more glad to be here than I thought. Riddick watches them move off -- then looks at the scotch left behind. It's still got one good swallow.
Leaving the boneyard, the scouting party reaches a cleft hills. Ahead is a canyon.
Hold up. He jumps onto a rock, puts the scope to an eye.
Didn't bite.
What?

Thought he might be coolin' it in the boneyard -- could either double-back to the ship or slip in behind us. So I left the bottle out as bait. SCOPE POV: PANNING the boneyard. FINDING the bottle. It's still got that one swallow.
But nah. Didn't bite.
CLOSER on the bottle. Only  we see that the scotch has been emptied -- and replaced with sand.
Working under the shade of a tarp, Zeke digs a communal g Three wrapped corpses wait nearby. He keeps a sight-line The crash ship. Shazza waves. Zeke waves back.

The scouting party transits a narrowing canyon. Lined wit bones, it makes us feel like we're in the belly of some b Fry squints at the ridgetops. More of those spires are vi on the canyon rims, looming like silent sentinels.  "What are they? Just mineral deposits?"
Captain...captain.... The Chrislams have found what appears to be a small deser Leathery petals are spread wide, revealing a round string ARABIC DISCUSSION. Desert fruit? Is it edible?
Wait, wait, wait.... Fry takes the "plant," pushes the "petals" back down over core. They all stare.  It's a baseball .
We are not alone here, yes? They look ahead, wondering what awaits them. But Johns is looking back.
Never thought we were.
HIGH ANGLE: An old WEATHER COCK CREAKS in the wind. Fry, Johns, and the Chrislams enter FRAME far below.
Assalamoo ahlaykum! The GREETING ECHOES through the settlement, built from st shipping containers. Tattered sun-shades flap in the wind rusty bike lies on the ground.
Assalamoo ahlaykum!
Long gone. Whoever they were. They move around a building -- and pull up short. Before looms a moisture-recovery unit, a hulking machine in disr Old jugs litter the ground.
Water...water there was here....
Allahu Akbar....
(translating)
"God is Great," yes?
I'm born-again. Fry manages a weary smile -- but soon her eyes revisit th abandoned buildings.  "Who were these people? Why did they leave so much behind?"

Through a window, we see the Johns and the Chrislams craw over the moisture-recovery unit, assessing repairs. PULL include Fry inside the settlement, inspecting... Refectory table. Place settings out. Years of dust. Photos on the wall: Settlers working modest gardens. Play baseball. Posing with children.
Fry enters a dark room.
Lights. No response to her command. She pats around for old-style switches. Nothing. Perceiving black-out blinds on a windo throws them open to reveal... A man standing right outside .
(through window)

Hey. Don't go too far, huh? Fry nods. Johns smiles, leaves. Just as her heart settles SOMETHING CREAKS behind her. It's an orrery, a mechanical device that shows the motion planets around their suns. Solar powered, the orrery star turning, CREAKING. One planet seems always to have sunlig
No darkness. No lights because no darkness....

Fry reaches a porch. It looks out over the rear of the settlement and more unforgiving terrain. She starts back inside -- but something glints at the edge of her vision. turns back...parts clothes on a laundry line...and sees t source of the glint. Excited hits on her breather. Fry vaults off the porch -- and starts walking as if on m bearing. Soon she's running.
Allahu Akbar! Allahu Akbar! Johns and the Chrislams trade looks.

Allahu Akbar! Fry stops on a groomed runway, out of breath. The others up. They too marvel at... The skiff , a light-duty vehicle of hybrid technology -- part bush plane, part space craft. Its fabric wings are wind-torn - the hull looks intact.

CLOSE on caviar being added to toast-points. A SCRABBLING SOUND stops Paris in mid-bite. He eases out rocker, moves to the rear edge of the ship and looks down A shadow ducking under him. Small rocks still trickle dow dirt rampart just climbed by...someone.
This now qualifies as the worst fun I've ever had.  Stop it . No response.
War-pick in hand, Paris eases to ground-level. He checks perimeter, looks inside the ship. Nobody. Is he being fuc with? Again? He hopes?
Audrey? Oh, Audrey....
What
Paris spins. The voice came from the cargo hold -- and no he expected.
Blades of sunlight stream in through cracks in the hull. enters to find Shazza and Audrey cutting open containers, searching for usable goods.
Tell me that was you.
Okay, it was me. What'd I do now?
Assailing my fragile sense of security, that's what.
What're you goin' on about? She's been right here for the last.... They all see it: Sun-blades are momentarily blocked by so passing outside. Some one .
(a quiet probe)

Zeke? No answer. Audrey springs to the other side of hold, puts to a crack there. HULL-CRACK POV: Far away, Zeke finishes digging the grave starts toward the ship. Audrey whirls back, mouths a silent alarm: "RIDDICK!" Paris goes bloodless. Shazza grabs the war-pick out of hi frozen hands, moves catlike to the main doors and poises ready to strike. Audrey follows with the hunting boomeran All eyes watch as... The sun-blades, winking off and on, chart Riddick's appro We feel like we're inside a magician's sword box, watchin blades shave closer and closer to us.  Suddenly he appears ... And Shazza swings hard.
No! Facing them is a TOTAL STRANGER -- burned, half naked, on still clutching the emergency-release lever of his cryo-l Shazza stopped one inch short of killing him.

I thought...my God, I thought I was the only one who.... He lurches toward Shazza, trying to embrace her -- and se and brain-bits BLAM-BLAMMING against her.  His own . The stranger sinks bonelessly to the ground. FAST RACK to reveal Zeke background, pistol leveled. He reads Shazza's horrified f and understands what he's done.
Oh, Lord....
It was just somebody else. From the crash. He was just....

Cripes galore, I thought it was him. The murderin' ratbag. I thought he was.... He rushes over to check the dead stranger. As he bends do FAST RACK AGAIN to reveal  Riddick in the background . He stands 20 paces off, still unseen by the others. His goggle eyes covet... Zeke's breather.
Fry exits the skiff.
No juice, looks like it's been laid up for years. But we might be able to adapt --
Shut up. Outside, Johns has an ear cocked to the wind.
Sorry. Thought I heard something.
